column2: peter, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this for TMJD and bruxism (teeth grinding). It did work surprisingly and my symptoms got a LOT better (after years of grinding and pain - I wear a biting guard at night which doesn't stop the bruxism unfortunately). I'm not in chronic pain anymore.I take magnesium oxide which is supposed to be poorly absorped: That is why I took around 1.75g yesterday. I had magnesium poisoning and was about to call the ambulance. It was over after appr. 3 hours. I had muscle weakness and was in a state of panic (I had the urge to hurt myself, but I could suppress it). So PLEASE be careful - you should not exceed 1000mg in my opinion. Mg Oxide isn't necessarily badly absorped as you can see. I am young and healthy, no kidney problems.One common side effect are loose bowel movements which I also experience. I will lower the dose now as I seem to absorp the product I bought quite well (too well lol).When you have problems with your jaw, neck and back, magnesium is worth a try.

column2: rewind1955,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking this over-the-counter supplement a year ago along with Calcium for Bone health.  My doctor did not suggest, but after much reading thought this drug would help prevent Bone problems later in life.  Well I began to suffer cramps, muscle and joint pain in ly legs especially in my knees.  I suffer these symptoms for a very long time, ask my Doctor could it be the Statins I was taking and stopped taking them, but leg pain continued.  Eventually I stopped all medicines and supplements one-by-one and come to find out the Magnesium Oxide with Chelated Zinc was the culprit.  So after a few weeks the pain in my legs began to ease, but not yet completely gone.  I do hope that I have not damaged the muscle or bone in my legs, and the pain vanishes soon.  It was a mistake to take this supplement with Calcium for Bone health, what a big mistake and disappointment.
